sources.title: Goopy Geer (1932)
sources.description: Goopy Geer is an animated cartoon character created in 1932 for the Merrie Melodies series of cartoons from Warner Bros. He’s a singing, dancing, piano-playing dog who is considered to be “the first Merrie Melodies star”, although he only starred in three cartoons. Watch on RetroFlix.org:  https://retroflix.org/goopy-geer-1932/

metadata.Plot: At a nightclub, the crowd demands Goopy Geer, and the lanky dog doesn't disappoint them. He gives a zany performance on the piano, but the employees and the customers are just as wacky. A gorilla waiter dances while serving. Three identical cats display a peculiar way of eating. A chicken has a nauseating way of making chicken soup. The nightclub singer tells corny jokes. Even the hat racks come to life and dance. A horse imbibing a too-strong drink provides the show-stopper.
metadata.Actors: Marcellite Garner, Rudolf Ising, The King's Men
